description.narrative: The general objective of this project is the creation and strengthening of Cuba’s institutional capacities to access and engage with the Green Climate Fund (GCF).

activity-description.narrative: Strengthening the NDA. The NDA will be strengthened through the capacity building, processes and the provision of equipment essential to fulfill its role, including the leadership and joint work that it must develop with other national agencies and institutions & Creating a strategic framework for t

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Establish a coordination mechanism with the National designed Authority (NDA) 1.2 Establish a No objection procedure . 1.4 Sources of internal and external climate finance are being monitored, 2.1 Stakeholders are being consulted on an ad-hoc basis 4.1 A range of financing strategies for individual projects. 4.2 Ad-hoc dialogue on climate finance planning between National designed Authority (NDA)/FP and some Accredited Entities.

comment.narrative: 1.1 There is no a coordination mechanism established with the National designed Authority (NDA) 1.2 No objection procedure established. 1.4 Monitoring and verification of climate finance flows is not established. 2.1 Stakeholders are not engaged in decision making processes. 4.1 No climate finance strategy exists. 4.2 Accredited Entities (international and direct access) operating in the country are not involved in Green Climate Fund (GCF) Country Programme design.

- Establish a no objection procedure through legal regulation, and other regulations required for the approval cycle of projects (Procedures for the elaboration, evaluation, internal approval and negotiation of the projects with the Accredited Entities, including the procedures related to feasibility studies and the social and environmental safeguards). - Creation of a technical unit, which will support the work carried out by the NDA, by reviewing and screening programs and projects. - Strengthening institutional capacities, mainly informatics, including the development of a website and dialogue platforms to facilitate communication among stakeholders on issues related to the GCF in Cuba.

- No objection procedure document finished, validated by the NDA and published. - Terms of Reference and Standard Operating Procedures for technical unit (Annex 2) - Terms of reference for the development of the website and print screens of different sections within the website. - Operational guidelines for stakeholder consultations for GCF project prioritization in Cuba was prepared and included in Guidelines Part 1. - Three knowledge products were prepared. (http://financiamientoclimatico.cubaenergia.cu/index.php/guias-de-agencias-e-instituciones-para-la-financiacion-climatica) (http://financiamientoclimatico.cubaenergia.cu/index.php/cuba-y-el-fvc-en-50-preguntas-y-respuestas). - Minutes from first National Structured dialogue and annual roadmap for engagement with the Fund. - GCF Country Programme developed, including a pipeline of projects ideas.
1.1 Establish a coordination mechanism with the National designed Authority (NDA) 1.2 Establish a No objection procedure . 2.1 Stakeholders are being consulted on an ad-hoc basis

1.1 Coordination Mechanism establishes. Creation of the Green Climate Fund Interministerial Committee, conformed by the ministries of Foreign Trade and Investment (MINCEX), Economy and Planning (MEP), Finance and Prices (MFP), Energy and Mines (MINEM), Agriculture (MINAG), AZCUBA Business Group, and National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH). 1.2 The first draft of the document: Guidelines for the participation of Cuba in the Green Climate Fund” containing No objection procedure document will be validated in the workshop No.2 planned to be held in November 2019. The final document will be completed in Quarter 1 2020. 2.1 Four workshops have been made in order to consult he stakeholders involved in the country.
